result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Amanda M. Borntreger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.
Successfully complete the 2 year probationary term on Ct. 2 which includes payment of court costs; anger management counseling; letter of apology to the victims.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of 2 (two) years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss the felony charge.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bond applied to court costs - paid in full.

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 

If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Letter of apology to the victims, due within 30 days of sentencing, pre-approved by the probation agent.

Anger Management counseling and any other counsling deemed appropriate by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda M. Borntreger

defendant.name: Borntreger, Amanda M.
defendant.address: W16244 County Line Road, Thorp, WI 54771

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Amanda M. Borntreger in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed, waived further reading and wish to proceed to plea and sentencing.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  State moved to amend Ct. 2 to misdemeanor battery 940.19(1) - granted. DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1 and amended Ct. 2.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty on both counts.  On Ct. 1 court deferred entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of 2 years.  On Ct. 2 the court ordered entry of JOC. Brief statements by counsel.  Court granted the DEJ on Ct. 1 for a period of 2 years and approved the agreement.  On Ct. 2 court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:  payment of court costs; DNA surcharge; write a letter of apology to the victims due within 30 days, pre-approved by agent; attend Anger Management counseling and other counseling as recommended by the agent.
Preliminary hearing on December 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Amanda M. Borntreger in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint; preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived.  PTC set.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant is prohibited from us corporal punishment on her children.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant is prohibited from us corporal punishment on her children.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amanda Borntreger appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on arrest header.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $500.00 cash and $2,000.00 signature bond; booking and defendant is prohibited to use corporal punishment on her children.  Court sets bond as requested by attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is October 7, 2014 at 1:00 pm  - rt
